data.meanings: increased/augmented/grew, exceeded, was/became redundant/superfluous, remain over & above, addition, exaggerate, accessory, surplus
data.sentence: The word وَيَزِيدُهُمْ comes from the root ز ي د and is associated with the meanings: increased/augmented/grew, exceeded, was/became redundant/superfluous, remain over & above, addition, exaggerate, accessory, surplus

data.meanings: wept, lamented/grieved, shed tears, crying, cause to weep, rain, unable to speak.
data.sentence: The word يَبْكُونَ comes from the root ب ك ي and is associated with the meanings: wept, lamented/grieved, shed tears, crying, cause to weep, rain, unable to speak.

data.meanings: to strike on the chin, lean the chin upon (with ala), chin, although its primary meaning is chin it may be rendered as face.To straighten.A decrepit/old/weak man.
data.sentence: The word لِلْأَذْقَانِ comes from the root ذ ق ن and is associated with the meanings: to strike on the chin, lean the chin upon (with ala), chin, although its primary meaning is chin it may be rendered as face.To straighten.A decrepit/old/weak man.

data.meanings: To sound murmured/rumbled or gurgled (water), run so as to make a noise [run/flow/trickle down so as to make a murmuring, or similar, sound], to be made to run [TA], sound rustled (wind), to snore or make a sound in breathing, to fall or fall down (making a sound to be heard at the same time) [sometimes used in the sense of falling absolutely], come upon a place or person suddenly or unawares, to be lax or flabby, to pass along or away or by from one place to another.
data.sentence: The word وَيَخِرُّونَ comes from the root خ ر ر and is associated with the meanings: To sound murmured/rumbled or gurgled (water), run so as to make a noise [run/flow/trickle down so as to make a murmuring, or similar, sound], to be made to run [TA], sound rustled (wind), to snore or make a sound in breathing, to fall or fall down (making a sound to be heard at the same time) [sometimes used in the sense of falling absolutely], come upon a place or person suddenly or unawares, to be lax or flabby, to pass along or away or by from one place to another.

data.meanings: Lowly/humble/submissive, still and low, to lower the eyes or voice, sink/nearly disappear in a setting place, be eclipsed/go away, become lean, whither/dry up, feign lowliness/humility in demeanour or voice or eyes, eject a thing, bow or bend down the head and body, be fearful.
data.sentence: The word خُشُوعًا comes from the root خ ش ع and is associated with the meanings: Lowly/humble/submissive, still and low, to lower the eyes or voice, sink/nearly disappear in a setting place, be eclipsed/go away, become lean, whither/dry up, feign lowliness/humility in demeanour or voice or eyes, eject a thing, bow or bend down the head and body, be fearful.
